analysis_software_name.description: A name of a computer package, application, method or function used for the analysis of data.

analysis_software_version.description: The version of software used to analyze data.

gene_name.description: The name of a gene, (typically) assigned by a person and/or according to a naming scheme. It may contain white space characters and is typically more intuitive and readable than a gene symbol. It (typically) may be used to identify similar genes in different species and to derive a gene symbol.

gene_symbol.description: The short name of a gene; a single word that does not contain white space characters. It is typically derived from the gene name.

genetic_variation_type.description: The class of genetic variation detected.
Enums: Both gene presence and mutation variation detected

input_file_name.description: The name of the file containing the sequence data to be analysed.

reference_accession.description: An identifier that specifies an individual sequence record in a public sequence repository.

reference_database_name.description: An identifier of a biological or bioinformatics database.

reference_database_version.description: The version of the database containing the reference sequences used for analysis.

antimicrobial_agent.description: A substance that kills or slows the growth of microorganisms, including bacteria, viruses, fungi and protozoans.

coverage_percentage.description: The percentage of the reference sequence covered by the sequence of interest.

coverage_depth.description: The average number of reads representing a given nucleotide in the reconstructed sequence.

coverage_ratio.description: The ratio of the reference sequence covered by the sequence of interest.

drug_class.description: In an antimicrobial context, a drug class is a set of antibiotic molecules, including antibiotic/adjuvant combination medications, with similar chemical structures, molecular targets, and/or modes and mechanisms of action.

input_gene_length.description: The length (number of positions) of a target gene sequence submitted by a user.

input_gene_start.description: The position of the first nucleotide in a gene sequence being analyzed (input gene sequence).

input_gene_stop.description: The position of the last nucleotide in a gene sequence being analyzed (input gene sequence).

input_protein_length.description: The length (number of positions) of a protein target sequence submitted by a user.

input_protein_start.description: The position of the first amino acid in a protein sequence being analyzed (input protein sequence).

input_protein_stop.description: The position of the last amino acid in a protein sequence being analyzed (input protein sequence).

input_sequence_id.description: An identifier of molecular sequence(s) or entries from a molecular sequence database.

nucleotide_mutation.description: The nucleotide sequence change(s) detected in the sequence being analyzed compared to a reference, represented by a specified notation system.

nucleotide_mutation_interpretation.description: A description of identified nucleotide mutation(s) that facilitate clinical interpretation.
examples: C --> A at the position aligning to 33038255 in the reference genome

predicted_phenotype.description: A characteristic of an organism that is predicted rather than directly measured or observed.
examples: Expected to contribute to antimicrobial resistance

predicted_phenotype_confidence_level.description: The level of confidence in a predicted phenotype.

amino_acid_mutation.description: The amino acid sequence change(s) detected in the sequence being analyzed compared to a reference, represented by a specified notation system.

amino_acid_mutation_interpretation.description: A description of identified amino acid mutation(s) that facilitate clinical interpretation.
examples: amino acid Trp24 is changed to a Cys

reference_gene_length.description: The length (number of positions) of a gene reference sequence retrieved from a database.

reference_gene_start.description: The position of the first nucleotide in a reference gene sequence (sequence being used for comparison).

reference_gene_stop.description: The position of the last nucleotide in a reference sequence (sequence being used for comparison).

reference_protein_length.description: The length (number of positions) of a protein reference sequence retrieved from a database.

reference_protein_start.description: The position of the first amino acid in a reference protein sequence (sequence being used for comparison).

reference_protein_stop.description: The position of the last amino acid in a reference protein sequence (sequence being used for comparison).

resistance_mechanism.description: Antibiotic resistance mechanisms evolve naturally via natural selection through random mutation, but it could also be engineered by applying an evolutionary stress on a population.

strand_orientation.description: The orientation of a genomic element on the double-stranded molecule.

sequence_identity.description: Sequence identity is the number (%) of matches (identical characters) in positions from an alignment of two molecular sequences.
